formattedAddress: 444 E 75th St, New York, NY 10021, USA
adrFormatAddress: 444 E 75th St, New York, NY 10021, USA

originalText.text:
I was diagnosed with glaucoma in my left eye 7 years ago. My vision was blurry, and my left eye was stiff, dry and painful accompanied by a stiff neck. 60% of the nerve in my left eye was lost and my eye pressure reached a high of over 26.
I went through the surgery in the eye, since eye doctor told me that the nerve in my eye might be damaged even more without the surgery. The pressure dropped to an almost normal state immediately after the surgery. However, it started rising in few months and then reached to the risky 26 again where the nerve in the eye may have been further damaged. I had used eye drops all the time but the eye pressure did not drop any further. All the symptoms in my eye returned.
I met Dr. Chung December, 2011 and started treatment. Soon after the treatments, I felt some relief in my eye and neck. In about 7 treatments, the pressure dropped to 19. Then I started taking herbal medicine along with acupuncture treatments. I continued receiving treatment for about 3 months steadily.
Eventually, the eye pressure dropped to 15 which are good. My eye and neck felt so much better. I continued receiving treatments occasionally for another few months. Since then, I have rarely received the treatments for many months. So far, my eye pressure has stayed at 15.
Dr. Chung explained me that it is the liver heat which causes glaucoma, and stress produces liver heat.
I really believe in her. I appreciate her of saving my eye!!

originalText.text: When I went for the first time I wasn’t sure if  acupuncture is really working, but I am glad I went and I found this incredible Doctor. I went to this clinic dizzy, couldn’t walk and I was very please with the care I received. The Doctor took her time double than she should spend with me  every time I was there. She is dedicated, and willing to make her patients feel at their best. For 2 years I took medicine, tried everything and the dizziness won’t go away. So glad I tried acupuncture and found this amazing Doctor and her beautiful team. After 5 sessions I started to feel much better and in the end my dizziness went away. Thank you so much to the entire team.

Thank you so much to the entire team.

originalText.text: I am a student  majoring in saxophone  in master program in Queens college. I was graduated from Berklee college of music with the same major this year.  After graduating from Berklee, I was going back to Korea and have treatments there because of my poor health condition. I had suffered from chronic stiff neck  for many years since I started playing the saxophone  Then, My neck was diagnosed as disc herniation in the entire cervical vertebrae a year ago. After playing the saxophone for many years, it had been getting worse due to the heavy weight  burdening my neck. My neck was so stiff and painful. Since the last 2 years, it was even developed to facial numbness. Besides, I had lower back pain along with sciatica recently. So, I decided to go back to Korea and took a break for one semester. On the way to Korea, I stopped by New York then was unexpectedly referred to Dr. Chung. In the first day of the treatment, my lower back pain and sciatica was gone !!  and started feeling better in the neck. From the second treatment, the numbness in the face was also getting better. So, I decided to continue studying without taking a break.  After one month of treatment, my neck and numbness of the face improved well enough to play the saxophone . Thanks to Dr. Chung!!!

originalText.text: I was diagnosed with hemifacial spasm over 15 years ago. It is a condition which causes constant twitching of my eye and the right side of my face, much like Bell’s palsy. To stop the constant movement, I had Botox injections. The Botox stopped the movement, but after 5 years, caused my eye to close and the right side of my face to droop and become immobile. I was unable to smile and to open my mouth completely. I began seeing Dr. Chung in early July. By August, my eye had opened. By September, my face no longer drooped, and now, in December I can smile and open my mouth fully. My tics and twitches have stopped and I have a normal face. People no longer comment or stare at me. I do not know how or how Dr. Chung’s acupuncture treatment works. But I do know she has changed my life and I am eternally grateful to her.

originalText.text: I am a friend of Joseph Parisi. I am writing this on behalf of Joseph Parisi according to his dictation because Joe is not able to write due to the brain damage. The followings are his testimonial. “I was hit by a car while riding motorcycle 3 years ago. In the next morning, I discovered myself paralyzed on the entire right side of my body with speech impairment and loss of memory. The doctor explained 6 spots of my brain was damaged by blood clot which was traveled from the hole in the heart created by the accident. I was in stroke condition. Besides, my external injuries were extremely severe. I had gone through surgeries 6 times. The entire femur bone and knee in the left side was replaced with titanium. My right thumb was so painful that I had to take Botox every 3 month to make it numb. The MD told me I must sit in the wheel chair for the rest of my life. However, I did not accept this sentence. I tried so hard to walk through physical therapy. Since 2 years after the accident, I started walking, but it was so limited that I mostly relied on wheel chair. I could not walk up the stairs and couldn’t walk more than 10 feet. I had received acupuncture treatment for 5 months in Manhattan before coming here. It helped me a little. Then I witnessed a remarkable recovery of a serious illness by Dr. Chung’s treatment from a Korean lady in my neighborhood. I decided to visit her. The dramatic changes started happening with her treatment. My right leg became strong. My trembling leg and arm become calmer. In 2 weeks, I was able to move my paralyzed, closed fingers in the right hand. I could open and close my fingers. In 4 weeks, I was able to move my paralyzed toes and raise my leg. I could have never done this motion before. In 8 weeks, I even walked up to 2nd floor. I am able to walk much longer than before. I can go to the bank by myself without wheel chair. All these activity were impossible for me before. In 8 weeks, I was able to grip things with the right hand. In 10 weeks, I even lifted my clutches and bags with my right hand. I am so enthusiastic about my progress. I am still going to the clinic anticipating more progress. I am deeply grateful to Dr. Chung.
